# trying to figure out opt git process



right now, i have two branches on the github repo: 

  * a dev branch
  * a master branch

the master branch is the "prod" one : 

it's the one i clone from for the instances of the project, (ex : irena.cahut.net)



i do experiments on the dev branch locally, once i have a feature ready to deploy i need to follow a specific procedure to merge it to the master branch and then deploy to every clone

https://www.atlassian.com/git/tutorials/syncing


vbrjhbv;ejbrve

each clone prod repo need to have 
  * a local master
  * a tracking branch to the remote master

=> nothing more ! i need to get rid of useless branches in history of the clones

to update a prod clone i should follow a very few steps like :
1. fetch the remote master
2. merge local master with remote master
3. (do i need to commit now ?)
4. how do i make sure i dont overwrite params like listening port, authcred, etc ???


i really need to go deeper in understanding git


    git clone https://github.com/rhino85/cahut.net.git  --branch master --single-branch

^^^^^^^ this command should only clone the master branch
